#Text=Soldiers without insignia guard buildings in the Crimean capital , Simferopol , March 2 , 2014 .
#Text=Image : Voice of America .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=There are reports that Russia could be ejected from the G8 group of developed economies .
#Text=Would this be a major blow for Putin 's domestic popularity ?
#Text=Morris
#Text=: Not really .
#Text=Brandist
#Text=: In present circumstances not .

#Text=There is a substantial constituency in Russia that is nostalgic about its imperial status , especially after the humiliation inflicted on the state during the Yeltsin period , and these conflicts are presented in this context .
#Text=Certainly recognition of Russia at the G8 was a prestige factor , but there are clearly compensations on an ideological level in the present situation .
#Text=This is an illustration of Russia 's ascendency vis-a-vis the US and the EU [ European Union ] in one sense .
#Text=What it all means in the longer term depends on a significant amount of variables , however .
#Text=Blank
#Text=: Ejecting Russia from the G8 is necessary but insignificant in its own right .
#Text=Kotsonis
#Text=: No , it would probably increase his popularity in an us-v-them dynamic .
#Text=Putin thrives politically on autarky and it may be treated as an attack on Russian prestige .
#Text=But less on Putin 's reputation at home .
#Text=File photo of interviewee Stephen Blank .
#Text=Image : Stephen Blank .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Is the Russian general public in full support of the deployment of their own troops into Ukraine , a separate sovereign nation ?
#Text=Morris
#Text=: No , this is a distraction by Putin from increasing economic and political problems in Russia .
#Text=A minority of Russians support deployment and I think support from ordinary Russians will fall when they realise deployment may result in the killing of fellow Slavs .
#Text=Burbank
#Text=:
#Text=There is no such thing as a united Russian public .
#Text=There are many views in Russia , as elsewhere .
#Text=Clearly , some people in Russia oppose this assault on Ukraine , as we have seen from the arrests and beating of demonstrators in Moscow .
#Text=There is a section of the academic " community " — also a deceptive word — that is opposed to the invasion .
#Text=If you are interested in this , read the discussion on Ab Imperio 's Facebook site , where many young academics are expressing their views .
#Text=I would like to repeat one point : the notion of a simple nationalized divide between East and West Ukraine is both false and counter-productive .
#Text=There are nationalists in many areas of the country , but there are also people with other political commitments .
#Text=It is dangerous for the Western media to reinforce the notion that nationalist sentiment ( pro-Russian or pro-Ukrainian ) is the only political force in Ukraine .
#Text=A whole generation has grown up since Ukraine 's independence and many people , old and young and in the middle , have ideas about sovereignty and politics that are not simply " ethnic .
